Tonight, we honor those who lost their lives & stand as one with their congregation. Tomorrow, we must act.
This tragedy calls for more than a day of platitudes from politicians. They must summon the courage & conviction to take action‚Äîaction to fight gun violence & bring people together.

We must speak out against hate & violence. Hold accountable those who seek to divide us based on what we look like, where we come from, how we worship, who we love, & which political party we belong to. That must be our resolve.

Common sense gun safety reforms would make an impact. Require universal background checks to keep people who are a danger to themselves or others from owning a firearm. Crack down on illegal gun purchases. Ban assault weapons.
But all that is needed for the triumph of evil is for good people to do nothing. Our faith & history teach us that injustice must be met with action.

There are no words to bring back the brave & beautiful lives lost to this unspeakable hate crime. But we know‚Äîfrom Sandy Hook, Sutherland Springs, Oak Park, & Charleston‚Äîthat love, hope, & faith always win.

The congressional office on Saipan will open at 9am today, 10/29. At 11am, we will have a FEMA official available to help us respond to questions you may have. We will also collect questions for other federal agencies whose help may be needed. Our phone number is 670 323 2647.

Governor Torres has asked CNMI government employees to return to work on Monday, 10/29 for damage assessments and cleanup. Those who cannot make it to work as a result of the storm must notify their immediate supervisor and apply for personal leave, he said. #TyphoonYutu

FEMA is also reviewing a $481,000 request from the CNMI for Disaster  Unemployment Assistance to help workers who temporarily lost jobs as a result of Mangkhut. The CNMI's request for both DUA and Dislocated Worker Grant funds are expected to be expanded to include #TyphoonYutu.

The federal government is expected to approve this week a $2.7 million Disaster Recovery National Dislocated Worker Grant to help the  CNMI recover from the damage caused by #TyphoonMangkhut, the U.S.  Department of Labor told the congressional office.

Here's a summary of key federal disaster aid programs that can be made available under the presidential disaster declaration issued for #TyphoonYutu  https://www.fema.gov/news-release/2018/10/27/federal-aid-programs-commonwealth-northern-mariana-islands?fbclid=IwAR3TW5buhKpGta-7J7ULiBT_dEePoIP0wgnKtYEBtLwmsN7sv8DK8Mn-f2Q

If you need your village homestead lot number to register for FEMA aid, visit http://www.dpl.gov.mp/ to view your village map. If you need more help, DPL staff will be available on Monday, 10/29. Call DPL Saipan 234-3751 to 54  Tinian: 433-9245  Rota: 532-9431 #TyphoonYutu

Medical  teams will be at Marianas High School and Koblerville Elementary School  from 8am to 12pm on Monday, October 29 to assess and address the  medical needs of shelter residents. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DqmJvZtW4AIFAgD.jpg

The U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services Saipan Application Support Center will be open on Monday, October 29.  Anyone who had an Infopass appointment during the office closure must make a new appointment. Interviews will be automatically rescheduled.
